page.title: 02Eridge Old Park,East Sussex
page.content: Eridge Old Park lies between Frant village and Eridge.It is a peaceful place and the home of many animals.The only things you can hear are the birds,the crunching of leaves under your feet,and sometimes the rushing of a small waterfall.There are many very old trees in the park some are over 400 years old.Many of the old beech trees have branches grafted together. If you walk very quietly you may see red deer.Following the public footpath through the park you will come to two lakes.Beside the smaller lake,fringed with bullrushes ,is a very pleasant spot for a picnic.It looks very picturesque with its small boat house and Canada geese swimming on its surface.Altogether the park makes a perfect place to enjoy the sussex countryside.
